snippet: The fine for failing to give Windows users the choice of competing Web browsers would be the first levied by the European Union for neglecting to comply with a settlement.
abstract: Europe Union is expected to impose large fine on Microsoft for failing to give users of company's Windows software choice of Internet browsers; fine would be first levied by EU for neglecting to comply with terms of antitrust settlement.

byline.contributor: Nick Wingfield contributed reporting from Seattle.

lead_paragraph: The fine for failing to give Windows users the choice of competing Web browsers would be the first levied by the European Union for neglecting to comply with a settlement.

headline.seo: Europe to Fine Microsoft for Breaking Antitrust Deal
headline.main: Microsoft Faces Fine in Europe After Breaking a Deal
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Faces Fine in Europe After Breaking a Deal
